nl_premises: Animals that fly must have wings.
z3_program:
from z3 import *


_Object = DeclareSort('Object')
x = Const('x', _Object)


Penguins = Const('Penguins', _Object)


HasWings = Function('HasWings', _Object, BoolSort())
Bird = Function('Bird', _Object, BoolSort())
Fly = Function('Fly', _Object, BoolSort())
Animal = Function('Animal', _Object, BoolSort())


clauses = []
clauses.append(Bird(Penguins))
clauses.append(Not(Fly(Penguins)))
clauses.append(ForAll([x], Implies(And(Animal(x), Fly(x)), HasWings(x))))


conclusion = HasWings(Penguins)


def is_valid(clauses, conclusion):
	solver = Solver()
	solver.add(clauses)
	solver.add(Not(conclusion))
	return solver.check() == unsat


ans = is_valid(clauses, conclusion)

from z3 import *


_Object = DeclareSort('Object')
x = Const('x', _Object)




Elephant = Function('Elephant', _Object, BoolSort())
Carnivore = Function('Carnivore', _Object, BoolSort())
Mammal = Function('Mammal', _Object, BoolSort())
Lion = Function('Lion', _Object, BoolSort())
Herbivore = Function('Herbivore', _Object, BoolSort())


clauses = []
clauses.append(ForAll([x], Implies(Elephant(x), Mammal(x))))
clauses.append(ForAll([x], Implies(Elephant(x), Herbivore(x))))
clauses.append(ForAll([x], Implies(Lion(x), Mammal(x))))
clauses.append(ForAll([x], Implies(Lion(x), Carnivore(x))))


conclusion = Exists([x], And(Elephant(x), Carnivore(x)))


def is_valid(clauses, conclusion):
	solver = Solver()
	solver.add(clauses)
	solver.add(Not(conclusion))
	return solver.check() == unsat


ans = is_valid(clauses, conclusion)
